title: 103_s210
content: LIMITATION OF COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS for pay for Members of Congress and certain senior Federal officials. Members of Congress and certain senior Federal officials will have their pay adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The pay adjustment for Members of Congress and senior Federal officials is based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The first adjustment took effect in 1995, with subsequent adjustments every 2 years based on the preceding year's data. The Executive Schedule Officers' pay rates are adjusted every 2 years based on the percentage change in the ECI. The adjustments are effective at the beginning of the first pay period after the adjustment in the General Schedule rates of pay. The annual rate of pay for Executive Schedule Officers is determined based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase under the Social Security Act. The effective date for these adjustments is the first day of the fiscal year. The Vice President's salary is also determined based on a specified rate. The Vice President's salary is adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI, rounded to the nearest multiple of $100. The Vice President's salary is adjusted based on the percentage change in the ECI or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year. The appropriate date for this adjustment is the first day of the fiscal year in which the rates of pay under the General Schedule take effect. LIMITATION ON COST-OF-LIVING ADJUSTMENTS FOR FEDERAL ANNUITIES FOR MEMBERS OF CONGRESS AND CERTAIN SENIOR FEDERAL OFFICIALS. Limitation on cost-of-living adjustments for federal annuities for members of Congress and certain senior federal officials. Amendments to the Civil Service Retirement System and Federal Employees' Retirement System regarding adjustments for annuities based on creditable service, including service as a Member or in a position under the Executive Schedule. Amendment to the Federal Employees' Retirement System regarding adjustments for annuities based on creditable service, including service as a Member or in a position under the Executive Schedule. The adjustment for such annuities shall be the lesser of the percentage adjustment under this section or the maximum percentage increase determined under the Social Security Act for the applicable year.
